title: Devyani & Sapphire to merge, form QSR giant
summary: Devyani International and Sapphire Foods India are merging operations. This union will create India's largest quick-service restaurant entity. The combined company will operate over 3,000 stores. This significant consolidation aims to accelerate KFC's expansion and revitalize Pizza Hut. The merger is set to become effective from April 1.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian markets began the year range-bound, closing slightly higher amid thin trading and continued FII selling. Key drivers ahead include Q3 earnings, budget expectations, and global cues like the India-US trade deal and Fed actions, with earnings growth anticipated to lead in 2026.

title: Stocks in news: ITC, Devyani International, Hudco, Tata Steel, KPI Green
summary: Markets began the New Year subdued, ending nearly unchanged. Analysts anticipate the Nifty will soon break its consolidation phase. A move above 26,200 could target 26,500–26,700. Investors are advised to buy on dips, focusing on banking, auto, and metal stocks. ITC, Devyani International, Hudco, Tata Steel, and KPI Green are in focus due to recent developments.

title: Decade of relief ahead for Vodafone Idea to recuperate
summary: Vodafone Idea has secured a 10-year extension on its Adjusted Gross Revenue payments, a move that has been confirmed by officials who have frozen the owed amount. Anticipated adjustments are expected to bring down the total significantly, providing much-needed financial respite to the company.

title: Rising incomes, rural recovery to power corporate India’s 2026 growth
summary: Corporate India anticipates improved performance in 2026, driven by rising disposable incomes, a stronger rural economy, and infrastructure spending, partially offsetting rupee depreciation. Key sectors like automobiles, banking, FMCG, IT, metals, oil & gas, power, and pharmaceuticals are poised for growth, with AI and premiumization emerging as dominant themes.

title: India valuations cheaper now, but pricier than regional peers
summary: Indian stocks offer a mixed outlook for 2026. Valuations are lower than historical averages, a positive sign. However, they remain pricier than regional markets like China and Korea. Foreign investors have stayed away for months. A turnaround in earnings, a trade deal with the US, or shifts in the US AI sector could draw them back.

title: Will the markets say cheese or continue to face January chills?
summary: Indian equities historically struggle in January, with the Nifty and Sensex often seeing declines. However, analysts suggest this year might differ, potentially boosted by the upcoming Union Budget.  Technical indicators point to potential gains if key levels are breached, while broader markets have shown more resilience.  The Nifty closed slightly higher on the first trading day of 2026.

title: D-Street welcomes 2026 on a sober note amid thin volumes
summary: Indian equities began 2026 on a muted note, with benchmark indices closing flat amid thin trading volumes and a lack of global cues. While the Nifty and Sensex saw minor movements, stock-specific actions dominated, particularly in the auto sector. The FMCG index faced pressure due to a decline in ITC shares following an excise duty announcement.

title: Stock Radar: MCX stock hits fresh record high in December; will the rally continue in 2026?
summary: Multi Commodity Exchange surged to record highs after a triangle breakout on weekly charts, with technical indicators signalling the rally may extend. Analysts say MCX’s strong volumes and dominant market position support the uptrend. Traders may buy on dips with a target of Rs 11,700 and a stop loss below Rs 10,900.

title: Irdai could change the norms for insurance consolidated investment
summary: The amendments also clarify that the prohibition on creating encumbrance or charge on assets backing policyholders' liabilities will not apply to repo, reverse repo and securities lending transactions, providing insurers greater operational flexibility in managing liquidity.

title: NHB flags PMAY 2.0 disbursal lag, urges housing finance companies to step up
summary: During a review meeting with chief executives of leading housing finance companies (HFCs) last week, the NHB chief said disbursements were "not up to the mark" and urged lenders to sharpen their focus on the programme, officials familiar with the discussions said.

title: Lending rates edge up to 8.7% as fresh loans get costlier
summary: State-run banks led the increase, raising lending rates by 16 bps month-on-month to 8.05%, while rates at private banks remained unchanged at 9.44%. Foreign banks, meanwhile, lowered lending rates by 6 bps to 8.18% from 8.24% in October.

title: KFC operators Sapphire Foods-Devyani International's merger to create fast-food giant in India
summary: Sapphire Foods India said it will merge with Devyani International, a move expected to consolidate local franchise partners of Yum Brands, which owns KFC and Pizza Hut. The companies said the proposed merger is subject to approvals from regulators, stock exchanges, the Competition Commission of India, the National Company Law Tribunal, and shareholders and creditors.

Nifty's resistance level is crucial, while Bank Nifty shows resilience and bullish momentum. Traders are advised to focus on banking, auto, and metal stocks while managing risks.

title: Investment bankers eye bumper bonuses after record $1.5 bn fee year in 2025
summary: Calendar 2025 saw investment banks, both domestic and global, earn a staggering $1.5 billion in fees from clients for executing deals. This is likely to translate directly into higher bonuses for top bankers from January, industry experts and headhunters said.

title: DeepSeek Touts New Training Method as China Pushes AI Efficiency
summary: DeepSeek published a paper outlining a more efficient approach to developing AI, illustrating the Chinese artificial intelligence industry’s effort to compete with the likes of OpenAI despite a lack of free access to Nvidia Corp. chips.

title: Obesity drugs may spur licensing, distribution deals for Indian drugmakers after patent expires
summary: The rising demand for obesity drugs is prompting Indian pharma firms to pursue licensing and distribution partnerships, particularly for GLP-1 drugs. Major deals have been signed, with analysts predicting continued growth in the market as patents expire and supply chain collaborations emerge.

title: TVS Motor shares in focus as Q3FY26 sales hit record high; December volumes surge 50%
summary: TVS Motor Company announced its best-ever quarterly sales for Q3FY26. The company also achieved strong sales figures in December 2025. Two-wheeler sales saw significant growth. Three-wheeler volumes more than doubled. International business also performed well. Net profit and revenue from operations increased substantially year-on-year. TVS Motor shares rallied in 2025.

title: ITC hit by wave of downgrades as cigarette tax hike darkens earnings outlook. Should you buy, sell or hold?
summary: Brokerages have turned sharply cautious on ITC after the government’s steep hike in cigarette excise duties, triggering downgrades, earnings cuts and valuation resets. While domestic brokerages warn of volume pressure and a revival of illicit trade, Jefferies has retained a Buy rating, arguing that long-term returns and cash payouts could cushion near-term pain.

title: Indian Bank shares in focus on Q3 update; total business up 13.4% to Rs 14.3 lakh crore
summary: Indian Bank shares are set to gain attention. The bank announced robust third quarter results for FY26. Total business saw a significant jump of 13.4%. Gross advances increased by 14.5%. Deposits also grew by 12.5%. This performance follows a modest net profit rise in the second quarter. Indian Bank was a top performer among PSU Banks in 2025.

title: Vodafone Idea shares in focus on receiving Rs 638 crore GST order
summary: Vodafone Idea shares are likely to stay in focus after the company received a CGST order confirming a tax demand, including penalty and interest. The telecom operator has disputed the order and plans to take legal action, stating that the potential financial impact could extend to the full amount demanded by the tax authorities.

title: Tata Steel shares in focus as CEO flags lowest steel prices in 5 years, global headwinds, and expansion plans
summary: Tata Steel shares may remain in focus after CEO T V Narendran highlighted pricing pressures from global oversupply, Chinese exports and trade barriers in 2025. Despite challenges in overseas markets, resilient domestic operations and ongoing capacity expansions underline the company’s strategic focus on value-added growth and long-term operational resilience.

title: Avanti Feeds among 4 stocks flash bullish signals, indicating possible uptrend
summary: On January 1, four NSE-listed stocks with market capitalisation above Rs 10,000 crore appeared on the bullish White Marubozu scanner. This candlestick pattern reflects strong intraday buying interest, with prices moving from session lows to highs, signalling firm buyer control and suggesting the possibility of continued upward momentum.

title: Adani Power, Vodafone Idea among 5 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
summary: Five Nifty200 stocks showed improving momentum on January 1, 2026, as their RSI readings crossed above the 50 mark after recent gains. This move signals strengthening price action and early accumulation. A rising RSI typically reflects a developing bullish bias and potential upside as trend strength improves.

title: ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares in focus amid sharp excise duty hike on cigarettes
summary: Cigarette stocks ITC and Godfrey Phillips India experienced significant losses following a steep hike in excise duties announced by the government. The new duty structure, effective February 1, has raised concerns about increased tax burdens, potential volume losses for legal players, and a possible resurgence of illicit trade.

title: Devyani International shares in focus after mega merger announcement with Sapphire Foods
summary: Devyani International and Sapphire Foods India are merging to create India's largest Yum! Brands franchisee, operating KFC and Pizza Hut. The share-swap deal, approved by both boards and Yum! Brands, aims to unlock significant synergies and drive accelerated expansion. The combined entity expects annual synergy benefits of Rs 210-225 crore.

Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. title: Zomato's Deepinder Goyal defends delivery partners over alleged traffic rule violations: ‘Indians are always in a rush’
summary: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal addressed claims of delivery partners violating traffic rules, attributing the issue to a societal rush among Indians. He emphasized that delivery partners are easily noticeable due to their uniforms, while others often go unnoticed.

title: Multibagger auto stock that rallied 215% in 2025 reports 50% jump in December sales; stock rises 5%
summary: Force Motors shares saw a significant jump on Friday, January 2, 2026. The company reported strong December sales, with total sales increasing by 50%. Domestic sales grew by 49%, and exports nearly doubled. Force Motors' net profit more than doubled in the second quarter and for the first half of FY26.

title: Sensex jumps over 350 pts, Nifty above 26,250 as earnings buzz builds
summary: Indian stock markets began Friday with a modest rise. Investors are preparing for upcoming corporate news before the quarterly earnings season. The Sensex and Nifty are set for a small weekly gain. However, ongoing foreign investor selling is impacting market sentiment. Both major indices are trading higher today.

title: SBI, HDFC Bank among Axis Securities 15 stocks to buy in 2026 for up to 54% upside
summary: January 2026 is poised to see significant IPO activity, with five major offerings totaling approximately Rs 18,000 crore expected to test investor appetite. These include prominent companies in AI, renewable energy, coal, lending, and hospitality, signaling a potentially active start to the year for India's primary market.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Motilal Oswal downgrades ITC; Citi maintains neutral rating on HCL Technologies
summary: Brokerage views on key frontline stocks reflect divergent trends. Citi maintained a Neutral stance on HCL Technologies while raising its target price due to improving sector prospects. Motilal Oswal downgraded ITC after a sharp cigarette tax hike raised earnings concerns. Emkay remained bullish on Devyani International, citing merger synergies with Sapphire Foods and long-term growth potential.

title: Gold, silver or stocks in 2026? How to invest Rs 10 lakh in new year for balanced returns
summary: Indian investors face a strategic choice after precious metals outperformed equities in 2025. Experts suggest a shift back to stocks for 2026, emphasizing diversification. While gold and silver saw significant gains, analysts warn against chasing euphoria. A balanced portfolio with a higher equity allocation is recommended for the coming year, considering market performance and risk appetite.

title: Aurobindo Pharma among 5 stocks that closed above VWAP, signaling bullish shift
summary: When a stock closes above its VWAP, it indicates that the closing price is higher than the average price at which it traded during the day, with the average weighted by trading volume.

title: Hyundai Motor shares decline 3% despite nearly 7% YoY jump in Dec 2025 sales
summary: Hyundai Motor India Limited (HMIL) shares fell 2.8% despite reporting a 6.6% year-on-year growth in December 2025 sales volume. The company achieved total monthly sales of 58,702 units, with exports surging 26.5%. This performance was attributed to strong customer interest, particularly in the new Hyundai VENUE, and recent GST 2.0 reforms.

title: Shriram Finance, TVS Motor among 4 largecap stocks witness 5-year swing high breakout
summary: Four NSE largecap stocks touched a 5-year swing high at the close on January 1, signalling strengthening bullish momentum. Such price levels reflect sustained buying interest and improving trend strength. While considered a positive technical signal, a swing high differs from a confirmed long-term breakout beyond established resistance.

title: Hero MotoCorp shares jump 2% as December sales rise 40% to 4.56 lakh units
summary: Hero MotoCorp is riding high on its recent sales success, with shares climbing steeply after announcing impressive December 2025 figures. The year-on-year increase in dispatches and demand indicates a thriving market, bolstered by the recent launch of exciting new models in the ICE scooter sector during Q3FY26.

title: E to E Transportation Infrastructure share price lists at  ₹330.60 on NSE SME, surging 90% from SME IPO price
summary: E to E Transportation Infrastructure debuted on the Indian stock market at  ₹330.60, a 90% premium from its issue price. The IPO was highly subscribed, with 526.56 times bids received, and raised  ₹84.22 crore, primarily for working capital.

title: Subdued start to 2026 continues as Nifty, Sensex open flat, Auto stocks surge
summary: The subdued trading session continued in the Indian stock markets on Friday opening, with benchmark indices open with marginal gains, reflecting a cautious stance among investors amid limited global cues as several Western markets remained closed for the New Year holiday.

title: EM Stocks Surge at Start of 2026, South Korea Vows FX Stability
summary: Emerging Asian stocks advanced at the start of the new year, led by gains in technology companies. Most regional currencies traded in narrow ranges.

title: Vodafone Idea share price jumps 3%, rises for 2nd day despite  ₹638-crore tax order
summary: Vodafone Idea shares rose 3%, reaching  ₹11.95, despite a  ₹638-crore GST penalty. The stock has gained 11% over two days, bolstered by government relief and a promoter-led capital infusion of  ₹5,836 crore aimed at strengthening its balance sheet.

title: ITC share price extends losses, falls 5% to hit 52-week low on higher tobacco tax - Should you still buy?
summary: ITC shares dropped over 5% on January 2, reaching a 52-week low of  ₹345.35, following a government announcement of a new excise duty on tobacco products starting February 1, in addition to the existing 40% GST.

title: Silver rate today jumps 2% amid bullish global cues - Will the rally continue in 2026?
summary: Precious metals began the New Year positively, driven by strong global cues. Silver led the rise, with MCX silver up 1.9 percent at  ₹2,40,500 per kg, while international spot silver increased 2.1% to USD 72.75 per ounce, following a record rally in 2025.

title: Gold price today: Rates jump on healthy spot demand, dollar's weakness
summary: Gold price today: MCX gold February futures were 0.69% up at  ₹1,36,742 per 10 grams, while MCX silver March futures were 1.74% up at  ₹2,39,967 per kg around 9:10 am.
